result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marc A Skowronek

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on August 24, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Court calls case, cites appearances.   Attorney Heidi E. Brewer appeared by video means for Defendant Marc A Skowronek. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Marc A Skowronek appeared by video means.  Sig bond was previously signed.  Atty Brewer acks rct of complaint, has explained charges and penalties to def, waives formal reading, and def stands mute.  NG plea to be entered.  PTC to be scheduled.  Def doesn't need to appear.  Case to be scheduled for 6/16/22 at 1:15 p.m.  Adj.  klr

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on May 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
No contact with vic in complaint.

10:51 AM Defendant Marc A Skowronek in court, in custody.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def recieves copy of complaint and PD info from DA.  Court explains process, right to atty, etc.  Def understands.  DA requests bail of NC with alleged vic.  $500 cash requested.  Def's address is same as vic.  Restraining order filed.  DA indicates lack of ties to community could indicate flight risk.  Court advises def he will be recieving a copy of the restraining order.  Def states doesn't have anywhere to go.  May go back to Minneapolis.  Def indicates he will be moving back to Minneapolis.  Can probably stay with friends.  Court questions def.  Court sets $1000 signature bond with condition of no contact with vic in complaint.  Court explains what bail jumping is.  Def indicates needs to get some clothes.  Court advises to make arrangements with ICSD.  Initial appearance to be held on May 16 at 9:00 a.m.  Can appear via Zoom or phone.  Court advises to contact PD office.  Nothing further.  Court advises that def can go through vic/witness coordinator to pick up items needed.  Adj.  10:58 a.m.  klr
